page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER:SWANSEA WEST
page.content: Cockett Police Station is J Division Headquarters for Glamorgan Police Constabulary. The Police at Cockett are responsible for motorway patrols on the M4.There is a C.I.D. office and police cells. Alsatians and labradors are used in police work and their handlers look after them at home. There are several community policemen, who work from smaller stations and police houses. They attend Community Council meetings,visit schools and patrol their areas on foot, using radios to contact their H.Q. They can use police cars if necessary. In this force the policemen wear helmets rather than flat caps and are allowed to wear spectacles. Generally, this area is fairly law-abiding,burglary and vandalism being the main problems for the police.
